Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics.factory

Interface IGraphicsFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BufferedImageGraphicsFactory, PixelGraphicsFactory, VolatileImageGraphicsFactory
    public interface IGraphicsFactory
    Interface for graphics factory
    Author:
    Achim Zielesny

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the main image

      • cleanUp

        void cleanUp()
        Clean up

      • attenuateToBackgroundColor

        void attenuateToBackgroundColor​(double anAttenuation)
        Attenuates the color of the the main image by an attenuation towards the background color. NOTE: If anAttenuation is very small there may be graphical effects due to round-off errors.
        Parameters:
        anAttenuation - Attenuation: 1.0 or bigger means background color, 0.0 or smaller means remain unchanged.

      • drawOpaque

        void drawOpaque​(java.lang.Object aGraphicsObject,
                int anUpperLeftX,
                int anUpperLeftY,
                int aWidthAndHeight)
        Draws an opaque partial image at the specified x-, y-coordinate to the main image.
        Parameters:
        aGraphicsObject - Graphics object (image) to be drawn
        anUpperLeftX - The x coordinate of the upper left position
        anUpperLeftY - The y coordinate of the upper left position
        aWidthAndHeight - The width and height of the image to draw on the main image (width = height)

      • drawTransparent

        void drawTransparent​(java.lang.Object aGraphicsObject,
                     int anUpperLeftX,
                     int anUpperLeftY,
                     int aWidthAndHeight)
        Draws a transparent partial image at the specified x-, y-coordinate to the main image.
        Parameters:
        aGraphicsObject - Graphics object (image) to be drawn
        anUpperLeftX - The x coordinate of the upper left position
        anUpperLeftY - The y coordinate of the upper left position
        aWidthAndHeight - The width and height of the image to draw on the main image (width = height)

      • drawSinglePixel

        void drawSinglePixel​(int aXPosition,
                     int aYPosition,
                     java.awt.Color aPixelColor)
        Draws single pixel
        Parameters:
        aXPosition - x-position of pixel
        aYPosition - y-position of pixel
        aPixelColor - Color of pixel

      • getImage

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Gets a buffered image from the internal image
        Returns:
        A buffered image from the internal image

      • getIntermediateImage

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getIntermediateImage()
        Gets an intermediate buffered image from the internal image
        Returns:
        An intermediate buffered image from the internal image

      • addParticleGraphics

        void addParticleGraphics​(double aPixelTransformationFactor,
                         GraphicalParticlePositionArrayList aGraphicalParticlePositionArrayList,
                         BoxSizeInfo aBoxSizeInfo)
        Adds particle graphics to graphical particle position array list
        Parameters:
        aPixelTransformationFactor - Pixel transformation factor
        aGraphicalParticlePositionArrayList - Graphical particle position array list
        aBoxSizeInfo - Box size info
